trans-unit.source: Provides a unique identifier for markup elements.
trans-unit.target: Provides a unique identifier for markup elements.

trans-unit.source: For Universal Windows Platform (UWP) XAML, this unique identifier is used by XAML localization processes and tools, such as using resources from a .resw resource file.
trans-unit.target: For Universal Windows Platform (UWP) XAML, this unique identifier is used by XAML localization processes and tools, such as using resources from a .resw resource file.

trans-unit.source: xUid directive
trans-unit.target: xUid directive

trans-unit.source: x:Uid directive
trans-unit.target: x:Uid directive

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Provides a unique identifier for markup elements.
trans-unit.target: Provides a unique identifier for markup elements.

trans-unit.source: For Universal Windows Platform (UWP) XAML, this unique identifier is used by XAML localization processes and tools, such as using resources from a .resw resource file.
trans-unit.target: For Universal Windows Platform (UWP) XAML, this unique identifier is used by XAML localization processes and tools, such as using resources from a .resw resource file.

trans-unit.source: XAML attribute usage
trans-unit.target: XAML attribute usage

trans-unit.source: XAML values
trans-unit.target: XAML values

trans-unit.source: Term
trans-unit.target: Term

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: stringID
trans-unit.target: stringID

trans-unit.source: A string that uniquely identifies a XAML element in an app, and becomes part of the resource path in a resource file.
trans-unit.target: A string that uniquely identifies a XAML element in an app, and becomes part of the resource path in a resource file.

trans-unit.source: See Remarks.
trans-unit.target: See Remarks.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Use **x:Uid** to identify an object element in your XAML.
trans-unit.target: Use **x:Uid** to identify an object element in your XAML.

trans-unit.source: Typically this object element is an instance of a control class or other element that is displayed in a UI.
trans-unit.target: Typically this object element is an instance of a control class or other element that is displayed in a UI.

trans-unit.source: The relationship between the string you use in **x:Uid** and the strings you use in a resources file is that the resource file strings are the **x:Uid** followed by a dot (.) and then by the name of a specific property of the element that's being localized.
trans-unit.target: The relationship between the string you use in **x:Uid** and the strings you use in a resources file is that the resource file strings are the **x:Uid** followed by a dot (.) and then by the name of a specific property of the element that's being localized.

trans-unit.source: Consider this example:
trans-unit.target: Consider this example:

trans-unit.source: To specify content to replace the display text **Go**, you must specify a new resource that comes from a resource file.
trans-unit.target: To specify content to replace the display text **Go**, you must specify a new resource that comes from a resource file.

trans-unit.source: Your resource file should contain an entry for the resource named "GoButton.Content".
trans-unit.target: Your resource file should contain an entry for the resource named "GoButton.Content".

trans-unit.source: [**Content**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209366) in this case is a specific property that's inherited by the [**Button**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209265) class.
trans-unit.target: [**Content**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209366) in this case is a specific property that's inherited by the [**Button**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209265) class.

trans-unit.source: You might also provide localized values for other properties of this button, for example you could provide a resource-based value for "GoButton.FlowDirection".
trans-unit.target: You might also provide localized values for other properties of this button, for example you could provide a resource-based value for "GoButton.FlowDirection".

trans-unit.source: For more info on how to use **x:Uid** and resource files together, see [Quickstart: Translating UI resources](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh965329).
trans-unit.target: For more info on how to use **x:Uid** and resource files together, see [Quickstart: Translating UI resources](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh965329).

trans-unit.source: The validity of which strings can be used for an **x:Uid** value is controlled in a practical sense by which strings are legal as an identifier in a resource file and a resource path.
trans-unit.target: The validity of which strings can be used for an **x:Uid** value is controlled in a practical sense by which strings are legal as an identifier in a resource file and a resource path.

trans-unit.source: **x:Uid** is discrete from **x:Name** both because of the stated XAML localization scenario, and so that identifiers that are used for localization have no dependencies on the programming model implications of **x:Name**.
trans-unit.target: **x:Uid** is discrete from **x:Name** both because of the stated XAML localization scenario, and so that identifiers that are used for localization have no dependencies on the programming model implications of **x:Name**.

trans-unit.source: Also, **x:Name** is governed by the XAML namescope concept, whereas uniqueness for **x:Uid** is controlled by the package resource index (PRI) system.
trans-unit.target: Also, **x:Name** is governed by the XAML namescope concept, whereas uniqueness for **x:Uid** is controlled by the package resource index (PRI) system.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Resource Management System](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj552947).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Resource Management System](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj552947).

trans-unit.source: UWP XAML has somewhat different rules for **x:Uid** uniqueness than previous XAML-utilizing technologies used.
trans-unit.target: UWP XAML has somewhat different rules for **x:Uid** uniqueness than previous XAML-utilizing technologies used.

trans-unit.source: For UWP XAML it is legal for the same **x:Uid** ID value to exist as a directive on multiple XAML elements.
trans-unit.target: For UWP XAML it is legal for the same **x:Uid** ID value to exist as a directive on multiple XAML elements.

trans-unit.source: However, each such element must then share the same resolution logic when resolving the resources in a resource file.
trans-unit.target: However, each such element must then share the same resolution logic when resolving the resources in a resource file.

trans-unit.source: Also, all XAML files in a project share a single resource scope for purposes of **x:Uid** resolution, there is no concept of **x:Uid** scopes being aligned to individual XAML files.
trans-unit.target: Also, all XAML files in a project share a single resource scope for purposes of **x:Uid** resolution, there is no concept of **x:Uid** scopes being aligned to individual XAML files.

trans-unit.source: In some cases you'll be using a resource path rather than built-in functionality of the package resource index (PRI) system.
trans-unit.target: In some cases you'll be using a resource path rather than built-in functionality of the package resource index (PRI) system.

trans-unit.source: Any string used as an **x:Uid** value defines a resource path that begins with ms-resource:///Resources/ and includes the **x:Uid** string.
trans-unit.target: Any string used as an **x:Uid** value defines a resource path that begins with ms-resource:///Resources/ and includes the **x:Uid** string.

trans-unit.source: The path is completed by the names of the properties you specify in a resources file or are otherwise targeting.
trans-unit.target: The path is completed by the names of the properties you specify in a resources file or are otherwise targeting.

trans-unit.source: Don't put **x:Uid** on property elements, that isn't allowed in Windows Runtime XAML.
trans-unit.target: Don't put **x:Uid** on property elements, that isn't allowed in Windows Runtime XAML.
